conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows vertical walls, visible thickness, and an angled view, confirming a successful transformation into 3D. The roof is removed to reveal the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have appropriate height and thickness (5), floors are distinct from walls (3), interior volume perception is good (4). Wall corner geometry is mostly correct (3). Angled view is good (5), interior is visible from an elevated perspective (3). Some minor perspective distortion is present (1). Roof is cleanly removed (5), interior spaces are fully visible (3). Geometry is clean (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: The number of rooms is correct (3). Adjacency relationships are well-preserved (4). Relative room proportions are good, with minor discrepancies (2). Major room identities are clear (2). Major wall positions align well (5). Wall lengths are largely proportional (3). Internal partitions are correctly placed (2). Doors are present and on correct walls, though some are suggested openings rather than detailed doors (3). Windows are present and on correct walls (2). Openings are proportionally sized and oriented (2).

interior_elements.notes: Most major furniture is present and recognizable (4). Kitchen elements are present (2). Bathroom fixtures are present (2). Furniture is placed in correct rooms (3). Furniture scale is reasonable (2). Orientation is logical (2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, and openings are clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry is readable (4). Interior is clearly visible (3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3). Consistent material usage (2). No major rendering artifacts (2). Clean background (2).

summary: The 3D conversion successfully transforms the 2D floor plan into a well-rendered isometric model, demonstrating strong geometric accuracy and good fidelity to the original layout.
